Description: Worn painted pottery shabti of Djedkhons with a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a modelled face and crossed hands in relief holding two black relief hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs(worn); the back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket.
Condition: poor - cracked at knee level, surface worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
